stories.title: A model that can create realistic animations of talking faces
Why some Asian schools are going wild with Scandinavian-style forest schools

stories.text:
Hey HN, we created a free audio/video transcription and editor that you can use for free. You can detect cheers, applause, filler words, edit transcript to edit audio, create audiograms and export in different formats.

We also have a chrome extension that transcribes any audio/video on the page you are on. After transcription you can follow along with the audio and read the transcribed text while the audio is playing. You can search for spoken content in a podcast or other audio/video content in your browser.

There are some limitations, our product only works on Chrome and Firefox, audio longer than an hour is not guaranteed to be transcribed (we will lift this limitation soon)

links: https://revoldiv.com chrome extension: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/revoldiv/cjjljbmei...
stories.title: Show HN: Convert audio or video files to text

stories.title: Ask HN: How do serverless/cloud functions work underneath?
Satoshi Nakamoto Leaked IP Address in Van Nuys, CA, Frequented by Elon Musk
Server World: How to configure servers

stories.text:
I've worked at several companies that were going through SOC1 or SOC2 compliance. My main impression of it is that after a long period of talking about compliance at every standup, at the end, almost nothing is observably different, yet now the product is SOC2 certified.

What even is this certification about? Does it provide any actual security, or is it just a scheme to make money for auditors? Would be interested to hear HN's take on it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is SoC{1,2} a racket?
